CatDescriptText: Mrs. Wanda Hill, 7729 Mumford Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 26, 1957, pg. 4, with question: "Do you believe we should have a state law forbidding strikes of trolley cars, buses, and taxicabs?" answer reads: "Actually I don't think that there should be a state law forbidding such strikes. Trolley, bus and taxicab workers strike for the same reason as others-higher wages.  And the strike is one of the most effective weapons to achieve that aim."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Wanda Hill wearing light colored ruffled blouse and dark skirt, standing in front of a building with glass block window and door with textured glass
